comment.author: 21042979@N00
comment._content:
Was such a fascinating and moving experience for me to see this spot a couple years ago. The bagpipe players' music sent shivers down my spine, not of fear, but more something undefinable--of such glorious sadness, almost.

Reminds me of a Frost poem:

"I dwell in a lonely house I know 
That vanished many a summer ago, 
And left no trace but the cellar walls, 
And a cellar in which the daylight falls, 
And the purple-stemmed wild raspberries grow.... "

comment.author: 56258631@N00
comment._content: The same place over 150 years later:

comment.author: 38990117@N06
comment._content: Wonderful to see this old old photo and, as macieklew shows us, it has not changed. You can climb the tower on the right of the photo and see views of the castle (also ruined), the town, beach and golf course.

comment.author: 64382689@N00
comment._content: A haunting image. -- Seen in your Around Scotland set. (?)
